p: Like other viral infections, the SARS-CoV-2 antigens are processed by specific antigen presenting cells (APCs) including macrophages and dendritic cells [ 44]. The antigens are then presented by major histocompatibility complexes (MHC) or human leukocyte antigens (HLA) to specific cytotoxic T lymphocytes (CTLs) [ 45]. It is thought that SARS-CoV-2 relies on MHC I, like SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, with minimal contribution by MHC II [ 46]. HLA polymorphisms have been correlated with an altered risk of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV [ 47], so it is predicted that polymorphisms in HLA-A, HLA-B, HLA-DR B1, HLA-Cw and HLA-DQB1 could also exert an effect on the immunopathogenesis of SARS-CoV-2 [ 47].
